text: Let’s test model final round, matches happened strongest opponents. add tree_depth parameter model. depth tree refers number levels tree .  colors leaves decision tree suggest ELO differences continue important factor final round chess tournament. model appears accurate predicting outcomes games large ELO differences. example, 333 points ELO, model predicts 63% wining chances . However, ELO difference less 85 points, player still good chance winning game. seen indicator performance players lower ELO ratings strong tournament. hand, ELO difference greater 85 points, chances draw. quick example use ChessOlympiad package.
code: cart_spec <-    decision_tree(tree_depth = 4) %>%     set_engine("rpart") %>%    set_mode("classification")  wrkfl <- workflow() %>%    add_model(cart_spec) %>%    add_recipe(recipe) round <- 11  cart_fit <- wrkfl %>%    fit(data=results)  cart_fit <- wrkfl %>%    fit(data=results) %>%    extract_fit_parsnip()  cart_fit <- repair_call(cart_fit, data = round)  cart_tree_fit <- cart_fit$fit  rpart.plot::rpart.plot(cart_tree_fit, roundint = FALSE) rpart.rules(cart_tree_fit, cover = TRUE) #> Warning: Cannot retrieve the data used to build the model (so cannot determine roundint and is.binary for the variables). #> To silence this warning: #>     Call rpart.rules with roundint=FALSE, #>     or rebuild the rpart model with model=TRUE. #>   ..y  Dra Los Won                                       cover #>  Draw [.45 .30 .25] when elo_difference is -176 to  85     51% #>  Draw [.55 .09 .36] when elo_difference >=         333      4% #>  Draw [.69 .15 .15] when elo_difference is   95 to 115      4% #>  Lost [.29 .61 .10] when elo_difference <  -176            20% #>   Won [.10 .30 .60] when elo_difference is   85 to  95      3% #>   Won [.17 .20 .63] when elo_difference is  115 to 333     18%
